required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunogenicity of Fluzone HD,A High Dose Influenza Vaccine, In Children With Cancer or HIV
clinical_study.official_title: Immunogenicity of Fluzone HD,A High Dose Influenza Vaccine, In Children With Cancer or HIV

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open label-study of Fluzone HD, a high-dose form of trivalent, inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV), vs. Fluzone, a standard-dose form of TIV. Subjects with cancer or HIV will be vaccinated twice with one of the two vaccines and evaluated for development of immune responses.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary objectives of this study are to compare the immune response of Fluzone HD, a high-dose, trivalent influenza vaccine (TIV), to Fluzone, a standard-dose TIV, in children with cancer and in children with HIV.
The secondary objectives of this study are to:
- Describe the safety and reactogenicity of high-dose and standard-dose TIV.
- Compare the immunogenicity induced by 1 dose, compared to 2 doses, of high-dose and standard-dose TIV.
- Describe the relationship between baseline lymphocyte numbers/function and robustness/durability of the immune response.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Seroconversion After 1 Dose of Vaccine
primary_outcome.time_frame: at least 21 days after first dose, which is given at the time of baseline evaluation visit, and prior to second dose
primary_outcome.description: The immune response of Fluzone HD to Fluzone was determined using the hemagglutination-inhibition (HAI) assay to each of the 3 antigens contained in the vaccine: H1, H3 and B. Seroconversion was defined as a post-vaccine HAI titer ≥40 if baseline was <10, or a 4-fold rise in HAI titer if the baseline ≥10.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Seroprotection After 1 Dose of Vaccine
primary_outcome.time_frame: at least 21 days after first dose, which is given at the time of baseline evaluation visit, and prior to second dose
primary_outcome.description: The immune response of Fluzone HD to Fluzone was determined using the hemagglutination-inhibition (HAI) assay to each of the 3 antigens contained in the vaccine: H1, H3 and B. Seroprotection was defined as a post-vaccine HAI titer ≥40.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving Seroprotection After Second Dose of Vaccine
primary_outcome.description: The immune response of Fluzone HD to Fluzone was determined using the hemagglutination-inhibition (HAI) assay to each of the 3 antigens contained in the vaccine: H1, H3 and B. Seroprotection was defined as a post-vaccine HAI titer ≥40.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Grade 3 and Grade 4 Adverse Events Possibly, Probably, or Definitely Attributable to Fluzone or Fluzone HD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initial vaccine administration through up to 8 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants reporting grade 3 and grade 4 adverse events possibly, probably, or definitely attributable to Fluzone or Fluzone HD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Sero-conversion for 1 Dose vs. 2 Doses of Fluzone HD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at least 21 days after each dose of vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of seroconversion to the 3 antigens contained in the vaccine was determined by hemagglutination-inhibition test and was compared by disease. The immune response of 1 dose vs. 2 doses of Fluzone HD was determined using the hemagglutination-inhibition (HAI) assay to each of the 3 antigens contained in the vaccine: H1, H3 and B. Seroconversion was defined as a post-vaccine HAI titer ≥40 if baseline was <10, or a 4-fold rise in HAI titer if the baseline ≥10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Sero-conversion for 1 Dose vs. 2 Doses of Fluzone SD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at least 21 days after each dose of vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of seroconversion to the 3 antigens contained in the vaccine was determined by hemagglutination-inhibition test and was compared by disease. The immune response of 1 dose vs. 2 doses of Fluzone SD was determined using the hemagglutination-inhibition (HAI) assay to each of the 3 antigens contained in the vaccine: H1, H3 and B. Seroconversion was defined as a post-vaccine HAI titer ≥40 if baseline was <10, or a 4-fold rise in HAI titer if the baseline ≥10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Vaccine Response by Seroconversion Compared by Absolute Lymphocyte Count (ALC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: ALC at baseline and vaccine response at least 21 days after last dose of vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: The relationship between baseline lymphocyte numbers/function and robustness of the immune response will be described through descriptive analysis of relationships between pre-defined variables.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Vaccine Response by Seroprotection Compared by Absolute Lymphocyte Count (ALC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: ALC at baseline and vaccine response at least 21 days after last dose of vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: The relationship between baseline lymphocyte numbers/function and robustness of the immune response will be described through descriptive analysis of relationships between pre-defined variables.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Local Reactogenicity Events After First Dose
secondary_outcome.description: Number of moderate or greater local reactogenicity events associated with the administration of Fluzone or FluzoneHD. Local reactions were defined as pain, redness, or induration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Local Reactogenicity Events After Second Dose
secondary_outcome.description: Number of moderate or greater local reactogenicity events associated with the administration of Fluzone or FluzoneHD. Local reactions were defined as pain, redness, or induration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Systemic Reactogenicity Events After First Dose
secondary_outcome.description: Number of moderate or greater systemic reactogenicity event associated with the administration of Fluzone or FluzoneHD. Systemic reactions were defined as muscle ache, fatigue, or fever.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Systemic Reactogenicity Events After Second Dose
secondary_outcome.description: Number of moderate or greater systemic reactogenicity event associated with the administration of Fluzone or FluzoneHD. Systemic reactions were defined as muscle ache, fatigue, or fever.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) by HAI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-vaccination, post-vaccination and 9 months after vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Serum antibody levels expressed as the reciprocal of the dilution needed to inhibit hemagglutination in vitro.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Geometric Mean Ratios (GMR) by HAI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-vaccination, post-vaccination and 9 months after vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: GMTs compared to each other as a ratio of the pre- and post-vaccine titers and as the ratio post-last dose to 9 months later. GMRs were compared pre- to post-vaccination and post- vaccination to 9 months later.

arm_group.description: Subjects with a diagnosis of leukemia will be vaccinated twice with Fluzone High Dose Vaccine and evaluated for development of immune responses.
Subjects with a diagnosis of leukemia will be vaccinated twice with Fluzone Standard Dose Vaccine and evaluated for development of immune responses.
Subjects with a diagnosis of solid tumor will be vaccinated twice with Fluzone High Dose Vaccine and evaluated for development of immune responses.
Subjects with a diagnosis of solid tumor will be vaccinated twice with Fluzone Standard Dose Vaccine and evaluated for development of immune responses.
Subjects with a diagnosis of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) will be vaccinated twice with Fluzone High Dose Vaccine and evaluated for development of immune responses.
Subjects with a diagnosis of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) will be vaccinated twice with Fluzone Standard Dose Vaccine and evaluated for development of immune responses.

intervention.description: Two doses of Fluzone HD will be administered to children with leukemia, solid tumor, or HIV.
Two doses of Fluzone Standard Dose Vaccine will be administered to children with leukemia, solid tumor, or HIV.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 3 years (on or past their 3rd birthday) through 21 years of age (not yet reached their 22nd birthday) at the time of entry into the study.
- Written informed consent (and assent, if applicable) obtained.
- Participant has a diagnosis of cancer or HIV.
- If subject has cancer, currently receiving chemotherapy and /or radiotherapy for the treatment of cancer or has received chemotherapy in the past 12 weeks
Exclusion Criteria
- Severe hypersensitivity to egg proteins or any component of Fluzone, or life-threatening reactions after any previous administration of any influenza vaccine;
- History of Guillain-Barre´ syndrome in the subject or subject's family (parents, siblings, half siblings, or children);
- Not willing to agree to acceptable birth control for three months after study immunization

link.description: Clinical Trials Open at St. Jude

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were ≥3-21 yrs. at study entry with diagnosis of cancer or HIV. Those with cancer were receiving chemotherapy and/or radiotherapy or had received chemotherapy in the prior 12 weeks. One participant was enrolled but was lost to follow up prior to randomization. 84 participants were randomized between 9/2010 and 10/2011.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants excluded if they had: pre-vaccination titer of ≥1:2560, severe hypersensitivity to egg proteins or any component of Fluzone, life-threatening reaction after prior influenza vaccine, history of Guillain-Barre syndrome in subject/subject's family, or unwilling to agree to acceptable birth control for 3 months after each dose.

group.title: Leukemia-HD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of leukemia who received the high dose Fluzone HD.

group.title: Leukemia-SD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of leukemia who received the standard dose Fluzone.

group.title: Solid Tumor-HD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of solid tumor who received the high dose Fluzone HD.

group.title: Solid Tumor-SD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of solid tumor who received the standard dose Fluzone.

group.title: HIV-HD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of HIV who received the high dose Fluzone HD.

group.title: HIV-SD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of HIV who received the standard dose Fluzone.

baseline.population: This was an open-label study where participants were randomized at a 1:1 ratio into Fluzone high-dose (HD) and Fluzone standard dose (SD) groups by disease group with the use of a computer-generated randomization schedule.

group.title: Leukemia-HD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of leukemia who received the high dose Fluzone HD.

group.title: Leukemia-SD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of leukemia who received the standard dose Fluzone.

group.title: Solid Tumor-HD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of solid tumor who received the high dose Fluzone HD.

group.title: HIV-HD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of HIV who received the high dose Fluzone HD.

group.title: HIV-SD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of HIV who received the standard dose Fluzone.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Rate of Seroconversion After 1 Dose of Vaccine
outcome.description: The immune response of Fluzone HD to Fluzone was determined using the hemagglutination-inhibition (HAI) assay to each of the 3 antigens contained in the vaccine: H1, H3 and B. Seroconversion was defined as a post-vaccine HAI titer ≥40 if baseline was <10, or a 4-fold rise in HAI titer if the baseline ≥10.
outcome.time_frame: at least 21 days after first dose, which is given at the time of baseline evaluation visit, and prior to second dose
outcome.population: Two patients in the HIV-HD group were excluded because data was only available at baseline. These 2 patients were lost for follow-up before evaluation for post-vaccine immune response.

measure.title: Rate of Seroconversion After 1 Dose of Vaccine
measure.description: The immune response of Fluzone HD to Fluzone was determined using the hemagglutination-inhibition (HAI) assay to each of the 3 antigens contained in the vaccine: H1, H3 and B. Seroconversion was defined as a post-vaccine HAI titer ≥40 if baseline was <10, or a 4-fold rise in HAI titer if the baseline ≥10.
measure.population: Two patients in the HIV-HD group were excluded because data was only available at baseline. These 2 patients were lost for follow-up before evaluation for post-vaccine immune response.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Reporting Grade 3 and Grade 4 Adverse Events Possibly, Probably, or Definitely Attributable to Fluzone or Fluzone HD
outcome.description: Number of participants reporting grade 3 and grade 4 adverse events possibly, probably, or definitely attributable to Fluzone or Fluzone HD.
outcome.time_frame: From initial vaccine administration through up to 8 months
outcome.population: Adverse events of Fluzone HD and Fluzone are provided as combined data from cancer and HIV patients, since there is no reason to believe one group is more susceptible to adverse events than the other.

group.title: High-dose FluzoneHD
group.description: 41 participants received 80 doses of high-dose FluzoneHD.

group.title: Standard Dose Fluzone
group.description: 42 participants received 82 doses of standard-dose Fluzone.

measure.title: Number of Participants Reporting Grade 3 and Grade 4 Adverse Events Possibly, Probably, or Definitely Attributable to Fluzone or Fluzone HD
measure.description: Number of participants reporting grade 3 and grade 4 adverse events possibly, probably, or definitely attributable to Fluzone or Fluzone HD.
measure.population: Adverse events of Fluzone HD and Fluzone are provided as combined data from cancer and HIV patients, since there is no reason to believe one group is more susceptible to adverse events than the other.

outcome.title: Rate of Sero-conversion for 1 Dose vs. 2 Doses of Fluzone HD
outcome.description: The rate of seroconversion to the 3 antigens contained in the vaccine was determined by hemagglutination-inhibition test and was compared by disease. The immune response of 1 dose vs. 2 doses of Fluzone HD was determined using the hemagglutination-inhibition (HAI) assay to each of the 3 antigens contained in the vaccine: H1, H3 and B. Seroconversion was defined as a post-vaccine HAI titer ≥40 if baseline was <10, or a 4-fold rise in HAI titer if the baseline ≥10.
outcome.time_frame: at least 21 days after each dose of vaccine
outcome.population: Two patients in the HIV-HD group were excluded because data was only available at baseline. These 2 patients were lost for follow-up before evaluation for post-vaccine immune response.

outcome.title: Rate of Vaccine Response by Seroconversion Compared by Absolute Lymphocyte Count (ALC)
outcome.description: The relationship between baseline lymphocyte numbers/function and robustness of the immune response will be described through descriptive analysis of relationships between pre-defined variables.
outcome.time_frame: ALC at baseline and vaccine response at least 21 days after last dose of vaccine
outcome.population: 30 participants did not have ALC data collected at baseline evaluation because they had complete blood count (CBC) ordered without differential count.

group.title: ALC <1000 Cells/mm³
group.description: Participants whose ALC was <1000 cells/mm³ were analyzed.

group.title: ALC ≥1000 Cells/mm³
group.description: Participants whose ALC was ≥1000 cells/mm³ were analyzed.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected for 21 days after each dose of vaccine. No "other" adverse events were observed.

group.title: Leukemia-HD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of leukemia who received the high dose Fluzone HD.

group.title: Leukemia-SD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of leukemia who received the standard dose Fluzone.

group.title: Solid Tumor-HD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of solid tumor who received the high dose Fluzone HD.

group.title: Solid Tumor-SD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of solid tumor who received the standard dose Fluzone.

group.title: HIV-HD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of HIV who received the high dose Fluzone HD.

group.title: HIV-SD
group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of HIV who received the standard dose Fluzone.

event.description: In 9-year-old with history of neurologic disorder who received FluzoneHD after recovery from sedation.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
